title: Well Control (Cross-Cutting) - AI Probing Questions
description: Questions applicable across all drilling sections during well control deep dive

questions.question: Kill sheet shows kill mud weight of 15.2 ppg but maximum rig capability is 18 ppg - what's your maximum reservoir pressure you can handle?
MAASP at surface is 2,800 psi but weak point test showed 2,600 psi - which value are you using?
Your shut-in procedure is hard shut-in - what's your choke manifold pressure rating vs MAASP?
When was the last well control drill? Were any deficiencies identified and have they been closed?
If you take a kick while tripping, what's your response - strip or snub back to bottom?
Gas migration rate in 12.5 ppg mud is approximately 1,000 ft/hr - how long before gas reaches surface from TD?
Your choke operator has IWCF Level 3 - when does their certification expire?
If you lose one pump during kill operation, can you maintain bottomhole pressure with single pump?
Volumetric control procedure is in your manual - have the crew actually practiced this?
Your BOP can shear drill pipe - can it shear the BHA components you're running?
questions.expectedResponse: Shear test results for BHA components

questions.question: Underground blowout contingency - what's your crossflow monitoring and response plan?
Bullheading is listed as contingency - have you calculated the required surface pressure and does it exceed casing rating?
Kick tolerance decreases as you drill deeper - at what depth does kick tolerance become critical?
Your well control procedures reference API RP 59 - which revision and have there been updates?
If you have to evacuate the rig during a well control event, what's the minimum crew to maintain well control?
